Fields.DialogueText: Brrr! What's with all this snow?
What, not enjoying this brisk weather?
Absolutely not! It's bad enough that a bunch of the world isn't hot enough, but it's even worse that even more of it is completely cold!
Well, we're out here, so we might as well get used to it.
I know. Doesn't mean I have to like it. Is there any way to heat things up?

Fields.MenuText: How about I read a Christmas story to you?
I thought that deserts got quite cold at night.
Doesn't your name mean "covered in snow?" This weather should be your best friend.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess that would at least bring a festive spirit to this weather. As long as you don't mention those reindeer. One of their names just makes my stomach churn.
Yes, but at least I don't have to deal with that kind of temperature drop all day long.
That is a cruel joke that people played on me.
Anyway, here's a blanket so you can stay warm.
Thanks, Captain. You're a real pal.
Don't mention it. What are friends for?
What about you, though? Will you be okay?
I'm fine. Just hang in there. We need to be ready for anything this world throws at us.
Don't worry. I may be a little chilled in this climate, but I'm as strong and determined as ever.
That's good. Things should heat up once we catch up to these Morganas.
@BATTLE
Wait, do you mean Don...
I said don't mention that name!
Then what shall I call you? Sandy? Dry-Dry? Hottie?
Ha ha. I'll stick with Nevada, thank you.
All right, ladies and gentlemen! Step right up, spin the wheel, and win a prize! Any prize!
That's a big roulette wheel you've got there.
Thanks! It took a lot of work to get it made. Want to make a bet? I have a lot of fun prizes, if the odds are in your favor.
I don't know...
Come on! You'll never know if you're a winner unless you try.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't the sum of all the numbers 666? That isn't a particularly auspicious omen.
Exactly what prizes did you manage to round up? And how did you get them?
And the price for losing?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I guess that's just the Devil's own luck, huh? Now that you mention it, since luck is a lady, does that mean that the Devil is a lady?
Oh, just different things, here and there. But, the details – that's a secret! I'll only tell you if you win.
Nothing much. Only a little penalty game.
Okay, fine. Let's roll. I'll go with the Top Line.
Well, quite audacious! We'll see if the fates favor you in this round. Here we go!
Come on, almost there...
Whoa, that was a big wave! Feel that?
Dang it, Nevada, it doesn't count if the house cheats!
That wasn't me! It looks like some Morganas are trying to stick up this joint.
Then it's time to show them the door. At least that round didn't count.
What? Of course it did! The sea tosses us all the same way. If fate gave you a bad hand, you just have to live with it. So pay up!
Later. Right now, let's focus on the real stakes out here.
@BATTLE
Well, the Morganas are certainly demons, so it's feasible.
How little is little?
That would be telling.
Nevada! What are you–?
Watch it! I don't want to get these nets tangled.
I'd worry more about the people getting entangled. What is all of this?
I wanted to try another fishing expedition.
Why? Oklahoma thought your catch was too small the last time?
Never you mind about that! This time I really am going smaller.
Shrimp?
Right you are! I tried some one night, and they were delicious. So I thought, why not catch a whole bunch of ‘em for a full course?
Hence all this gear.
Exactly. Mind giving me a hand?

Fields.MenuText: What sort of meal do you want to make with them?
Maybe you should go for a smaller catch? We're going to run out of room here.
Looks like you found something to like about the ocean after all.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure. A cocktail, maybe?
Maybe, but what if a giant shrimp passes by? One as big as a shark or a sea monster, and my trap is too small?
A little, I guess. The sea can have its own treasures. It's just a shame they're buried under all this water.
Look, all of this netting – not to mention the support structures – is going to get in the way. You need to stow it somewhere before we get thrown into another battle.
Too late.
Oh, no...
Don't worry, I've still got this. It's gonna be a little rough, but a sure bet doesn't get the blood pumping!
@BATTLE
With the amount of shrimp you're after, you could throw a cocktail party.
Nevada, I don't think there are shrimp that big.
You never know what's hiding down there. The Morganas came from the sea, so who knows what else lurks beneath the surface?
Well, at least you're trying new things. That's a start.
What's with the pickaxe? Going prospecting for gold?
No, if I went mining it would be for silver. I'm after dinosaurs.
Dinosaurs?
Or fossils, in any case. Salt Lake told me about the dinos in her state, but there are some in mine, too. So I thought, why not find some more out here? I bet Okie doesn't have any.

Fields.MenuText: Actually, I heard that there are a ton of fossils in Oklahoma.
I don't think you can dig all the way out here.
Funny thing– most of the fossils in Nevada came from when it was part of the ocean. Puts a new perspective on things, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: What? No fair! Oh, well, I'll just have to try harder.
Then we drain the sea first!
What!? That's terrible. You don't think that the ocean might come back, do you?
Anyway, I don't think that it's something you can manage out here, so maybe you should look for something you can collect.
Hmm... Say, this war against the Morganas will be infamous for generations– maybe eons– to come, right?
Probably. It's certainly changed things all right.
Then maybe I should collect Morgana "fossils." That way future generations can have a better knowledge of the past.
I'll settle for just keeping them off our backs for a while.
Not to worry, Captain. It won't be long until we drive those miserable monsters to extinction!
@BATTLE
I was hoping you had forgotten about that idea.
Well, at least it would make your road trip easier.
Not funny.
Are you sure that's safe?
One of the British girls takes trophies from her kills. How dangerous can it be?
*ALARM*
Should I just stop saying things like that?
Nevada, why is there a bunch of sand all over the deck?
That's easy. I had it put on board the last time we were close to shore. Sadly, it's beach sand, so not quite as fine as I would like, but still...
No, I mean why did you spill it all over the halls?
We've got cacti around. This should add to the ambience. I'm already reminded of home.

Fields.MenuText: Clean it up. We don't want it to get caught in the gears of something.
It'll get all mucky as soon as some water splashes aboard.
It's getting in my shoes!

Fields.DialogueText: Sigh... I suppose you're right. It's tough enough getting my systems to reach optimal efficiency without stray particles mixing in.
Good point. Maybe if I move the sand inside?
Oh, don't get so worked up. A little sand on your feet just keeps you on your toes!
Look, I don't mind if you keep a bottle of sand or something in your private quarters, but everyone needs to be able to work efficiently if we want to defeat the Morganas.
I understand, Captain. Just as long as I get to keep some sand to remind me of home, I'll be satisfied.
I wonder when we will see our homes again?
Who knows? But our luck will turn around one day. You'll see.
It better. It looks like it's led us straight to other Morganas.
@BATTLE
No.
Oh say, can you see, by the dawn's early light!
Nevada, what are you doing?
Doing a little cabaret routine for everyone. I'm starting off with the National Anthem, and then I'll segue into a nice tap-dancing number.
I mean what are you doing in the middle of a battle like this!?
Just giving some good cheer to the troops! A good song never hurt anyone, and it might give us the encouragement to give the Morganas the hurt they deserve.

Fields.MenuText: We need you to provide support, battle support, with your guns.
Is this really the best time?
Well, then, you had better do your best performance. Make it count!

Fields.DialogueText: I already am. See?
It is at the moment of the climax, when your life is on the line, that you can put your full emotions into the song. Inspiring everyone counts the most.
You know I will, Captain!
You do have a really good singing voice.
Thanks! The only flaw doing it like this is that those troublesome Morganas keep trying to drown out my lyrics.
Don't worry. They'll sing their swan song soon enough.
@BATTLE
Huh? But, how...?
I can multitask like this easily. So don't worry. I've got it all in the bag.
Nevada, where are you?
Captain, watch out!
Huh? Ow! What's the idea of hitting me with a bat?
I'm sorry! I was in the middle of trying to hit the piñata.
A piñata?
Yep! I may be a proud American, but I have some ol' Mexican blood in me as well. I thought this would be a fun little thing to do. Break it open and you'll get a special prize.
Is the prize something I would actually want?
Well, that is for you to find out. Life's a gamble, you know. Want to take a swing yourself?
Sure. Wish me luck.

Fields.MenuText: Hyaaaaah! [Take a mighty swing, putting everything you can into it.]
Ha! Ha! [Take some tentative swings to warm up.]
Take that! [Study the piñata closely, and then strike the weakest point.]

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit! Yee-haw! Though you might have overdid it.
No, no, that's not how it's done. Watch this! See? I really nailed it, didn't I?
Nice shot, Captain! Hedge that bet!
Well, anyway, it's busted now. So, what did you put inside of it?
Candy, see?
Oh! For a moment I was worried. I'll just have one, if you don't mind.
Wait!
Now what?
I... may have hidden a spicy one in there.
Shoot. Which one?
Not a clue! The gamble doesn't end just because the piñata's gone. Unless you're me, and you like spicy things.
Of course it doesn't. In any case, that will have to wait. For now, we have Morganas to crack.
@BATTLE
Oh, you certainly nailed it. Straight into the floor.
Trying to grow some tumbleweed?
Sagebrush, to be more exact. Less risk of it rolling around.
And you intend to plant them about the ship?
Of course! I thought they would help improve the decor for the troops.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure that everyone will find the appearance appealing.
You must really like this kind of plant.
Are you sure they will do okay out here?

Fields.DialogueText: Nonsense! There's a comfortable drabness to them. A little homely, I suppose, but dirt-brown like the earth herself.
I sure do! You can see these beauties all over the place back home.
Don't worry. They're nice and hardy, just like me.
Well, I admit that they do give a unique flavor to the ship. I'm just glad you're not trying to use cacti again.
A fair few of the crew decided the Morganas were pricking us enough. But we can prick back. In order to defeat the cactus, you must become the cactus.
That doesn't make sense.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Easier to show you than to tell you. Come on!
There is a land that I love the best, fairer than all I can see...
Baking some bread?
Kneading up the flour right now!
That's good, but don't you think you should move that grass out of the way? You don't want it to get mixed in by mistake.
That grass is the flour.
Really?
Yep, some traditional ricegrass from my homeland. I was growing it alongside the sagebrush.
It is safe to eat?
Of course! Montina flour is very safe – and healthy, too.

Fields.MenuText: Where do you keep getting the flora?
Interesting kind of grass. I presume it is pretty hardy and determined– just like you.
What sort of bread do you intend to make?

Fields.DialogueText: Pitched it to Command as part of my food budget. I'm pretty sure they think I've gone vegetarian lately.
You guessed right! Even if it is burned to pieces or eaten up, it resurges in no time.
I was thinking of some sandwich bread so we could have a little snack. That sound good?
I look forward to seeing what you make. Is the oven supposed to be smoking like that?
Oops! I'll have to start the batch over again.
Douse it and meet me on the bridge. We have some Morganas to burn.
@BATTLE
That's the sort of spirit we need in these hard times.
It sounds great.
Nice cowboy hat you've got there, Nevada. Trying to get the old West theme going agai...?
Captain, watch out!
Huh? Wha-! Exactly why is a cowboy throwing around a boomerang?
This isn't for an American cowboy outfit. I was trying out the look of an Australian one.
Interested in going Down Under, are you?
Sure am! There's a lot of lovely terrain in the interior of the little continent – perfect for our road trip.

Fields.MenuText: I heard that some of the wildlife there can be sort of dangerous.
Just watch it with the boomerang, okay? Though it would make an interesting technique if you mastered it.
Well, it would be pretty cool. I've heard that there are a lot of unique things you can see there.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, that's just another gamble we'll have to take. They can't be any worse than Morganas.
You're right. I'll be more careful and master this in no time at all!
My thoughts exactly. I especially want to see a kangaroo up close. I've always been curious about how it's different from a kangaroo rat.
Well, our road trip is certainly going to be spectacular. We just need to figure out how to handle the land parts.
I'm still working on it. Right now, though, surf's up!
I know you'll come up with something. Let's deal with those water hazards for now.
Reckon I can hit one with the boomerang from here?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You can try. If it doesn't come back, probably best to let them keep it.
Whew, that was a rough one.
The Morganas seem to keep getting stronger and stronger. It just means we'll have to work even harder to catch up with them.
Still, it's times like this that I wonder why they started causing trouble all of a sudden.
Who knows? My latest theory is that they came from outer space.
Really.
I'm dead serious. They spied on us for years, and now they are coming to claim the planet.

Fields.MenuText: Have you been reading too many sci-fi comics lately?
Given how you Belles are a lot like them, in a way, doesn't that make you an alien?
Isn't this a little farfetched?

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, blame Lexington! She's the one who keeps recommending stuff to us.
Maybe we are! Watch yourself, Captain – once we're finished with the Morganas, you're next!
A talking ship isn't?
Aliens or ghosts, it doesn't really matter too much right now. What matters is holding them back. So let's get back to work. We never know when or where the next strike comes.
You're right. Although... what do you think it would be like to travel to the stars?
Thinking of an intergalactic road trip now?
No, good ol' Earth is enough for me. Still, sometimes I just like to wonder.
Keep wondering. You never know what this war might teach us.
Good point.
Locked and loaded, Nevada?
Like a pair of rigged dice, Captain!
@BATTLE
War teaches you how to fight wars, Captain. The sooner we stop looking over our shoulders, the sooner we can look up!
Nevada, what the heck is with these bells!? Are we under attack or something?
Oh, Captain, I was just installing a new bell system to ring hourly. Kind of like one of those old Spanish missions. Helps keep you aware of the time, no?
That's one way to look at it. But... never mind that. Why did you place the bells here, of all places?
You don't want it on the ship? I worked so hard to install it...
No, I don't. First things first! I was talking about the certain spot on the ship that you chose.
What's wrong with it? The acoustics are really good and...
You put it in the men's head! How exactly is this a good idea?
Well, the oldest and finest church in my home state has its bells in such a location. If it's good enough for them, it's good enough for us.

Fields.MenuText: Define "good."
How did you even get the bells in there?
Look, no one can even go to the restroom like this.

Fields.DialogueText: It works, doesn't it?
A lot of hard work and a hole in the wall.
It will be a little tricky, but I'm sure everyone can work around it...
Look, you need to move the bells, or I'll do...
Ow, my ears! I thought they were only supposed to ring by the hour!
Normally, yes, but I set them up to sound off whenever we detect Morganas.
How do they even... Never mind. Just move them somewhere else. And tone down the decibel level! At this rate, the bells will tell the Morganas we're stunned and waiting to be mopped up.
@BATTLE
I think we've got different criteria for declaring a problem solved.
Even more trouble...
The bell is hanging right over the toilet stall!
We have an alarm for that.
Then you'd better get it up to snuff.
Hey, Captain!
Oh, Nevada! What's with the black spots? Some kind of tattoo, or are you coming down with something?
Nothing of that sort. This is what I call my jaguar look. You like?
Jaguar?
I'm thinking of giving a new paint job to the ship, but I wanted to try it out on myself first. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: So, are there jaguars in Nevada – the state, I mean?
That look does suit you, I must admit. A classy yet deadly hunter. A real cool cat.
The jaguar's appearance does work well for camouflage, but will it really work out here?

Fields.DialogueText: A few, but not many. I hope they can hang in there.
Thanks. When I strike, those Morganas will never know what hit ‘em.
That's why I thought of the idea. Good point about the background, though. But I don't want to dress up all blue instead.
Not sure what the jaguar look would be like on your hull, but I do admit that it would be a hit on the road. A real jaguar cruising down the highway.
Yeah, but I salute the effort. Anyway, I just hope the real ones survive. Natural wonders like them are my inspiration as a fighter.
You think it'll work? For camouflage, I mean?
You're right. Time to hunt some prey!
@BATTLE
No idea. But it'll give the crew something to fight for, won't it? Victory comes and goes, but people need excitement through it all.
*ALARM*
There's the bells. Time to deliver.
Okay, from the way you're saying that, I'm thinking there's a pun or something, but-
Sorry. There's a British sports saloon called the SS Jaguar. I took a gamble on your interest in land transportation and lost.
Nevada, what's with this huge paddle wheel thing you have laying on the deck?
I was thinking of trying to make the ship into a riverboat, for a change of pace.
Huh? I thought that you didn't like the water.
I don't, but I remembered that Mark Twain started out his literary career in the desert.
Oh? That's interesting.
So I thought that if a river man like him can adjust and thrive in the desert, then someone like me can learn to like the sea.

Fields.MenuText: It's good to see you're growing and learning to try new things.
Don't force yourself to like something, though. You should just be yourself.
What river would you like to travel on?

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks. I like betting on new experiences. Even if things don't work out the way I expected, it's still an adventure.
You're right. Still, the water isn't bad... Just different from what I am used to.
There are actually a lot of rivers in Nevada that I would like to explore. I'd probably start with the Colorado and work my way down.
Anyway, we're getting sidetracked. We can't have this huge wheel lying around. I want it removed.
Don't worry. It'll be gone as soon as I have it installed.
I don't want it attached, either. Maybe for our road trip, but it won't work out in the ocean.
I heard that Mississippi wanted to do something like this.
That's beside the point. Remove it now, or...
Oops, looks like I have to deal with some Morganas. See you!
Don't forget to put it away afterwards!
@BATTLE
Hey, Captain? Mind if I bring some animals on board?
What sort of animals?
Oh, just some pack animals to help with the supplies.
It would be a little tricky... but I know some of the other Belles have had some luck with this kind of thing. Make a request the next time we're at port, and we can look into moving a few aboard.
I won't be able to just get them right away. It'll take some work to find a vendor selling them.
"Them?" What exactly do you want to bring to the ship? What species, and how many?
Um... Camels.
Camels.
Now hear me out, okay? They are actually quite useful animals. They need little water and are especially hardworking. Please?

Fields.MenuText: I have also heard that they tend to spit at people they don't like.
Okay, but you will have to take full responsibility for them.
Are you sure that the camels will do well out here?

Fields.DialogueText: Part of their charm.
What, can't we share them together?
Don't worry, they'll be fine. I'm a desert lover too, and look at me!
Okay, maybe that wasn't the best idea. Besides, if I got one I'd never get rid of it. And then I'd get arrested if I tried to drive with one on the highway.
Moreover, I think we have enough orneriness to handle with the Morganas. They just never seem to give up.
@BATTLE
Nevada, pets are a great responsibility. Can you really look after them?
Of course! Probably. I mean, Cousin Augusta manages it all right.
Nevada...
Fine.
Nice of you to play Shanghai with me. It's always fun to gamble with cards.
No problem. But no bets, remember?
If you insist. Your turn.
Okay... Oh! Well, I'll lay down my sets. Now I just have to get rid of the remainder.
What? You just laid down your hand this early?
Yes? I finished my hands, and I'd get a penalty if they were still in my hand at the end.
That's your style. Mine is to wait until you are ready to go all out.

Fields.MenuText: Might make more sense if we had more players.
Isn't that tactic kind of risky?
We all have our own ways to play the game.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. I could see if Salt Lake's interested, or Oklahoma, I guess.
Yes, but that is the thrill of it. Never knowing until the last second who wins and who loses. That is the lifeblood of a gambler.
Indeed. You have your style, I have mine. In the end, Lady Luck herself decides which style flies and which crashes.
Anyhow, your move.
And move I will. Victory!
That was lucky. But that's just who you are, I guess.
The real luck was that I was able to finish this round. We have some Morganas to take care of.
@BATTLE
I've been working on the railroad, all the livelong day!
What's with the conductor impersonation?
Ah, Captain! I came up with a solution to my land travel trouble.
You have? What's the answer this time?
Simple: railroads! They can carry a lot of weight, so all we need to do is hitch a ride on one.
Aren't you... Kind of big for that?
Oh, it will require adjusting the trains a little, but I'm sure it won't be that hard.
A little, she says.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think you could fit inside one, even if we expanded it.
But then you wouldn't really have control over the route. Would you?
What if the train derails?

Fields.DialogueText: Then I would just ride on top. It's as simple as that.
You're right. Yeah, it wouldn't be the same as driving free like the wind.
That is a good point. If the train broke down, I'd get really hurt.
Maybe that wasn't such a good idea for my travel plans. But, it could make for a decent inland ship system, couldn't it?
Maybe. In any case, it's good that you look ahead to the future.
Always, Captain. But I keep one eye on the present. I need to, with all these Morganas sneaking around.
@BATTLE
Better watch out for the low-hanging tunnels, then.
I was more concerned about the other way around.
Brace yourselves! I'm doing a quick maneuver.
@BATTLE
Nevada, you really need to be more careful before you take big risks in a fight like this.
Just wanted to give it my all.
Still, if you get in too deep, you might not get out of there alive. Don't forget, we have plans for after the war.
I've got such big plans, Captain. Whether I'll see them through... well, I can only do so much to ensure that.
What do you mean?
I'm an old ship, Captain. Sure, I've put in a lot of good service, but when a tool grows old, you never know when it might break.
You don't really think that will happen to you, right? Is that why...?
It's always why, Captain. Everything I do... I just think it'd be better to go out on a high note than live to be forgotten.

Fields.MenuText: You're a living being, Nevada, not just a weapon or tool.
I'll be here for you always, I promise.
Death is taking the easy way out.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm both of these things, Captain. That's the problem.
Thanks, Captain.
You're right. It's not like me to give up so easily.
Sorry for getting so down.
That's all right. This war takes its toll on all of us, and I wonder what the future will be like, too. We just have to be confident that we can face any challenges that come our way.
That's for certain. Nothing will keep me down for good!
That's the spirit.
A soulless weapon wouldn't cause so much mischief, would she? You're real, Nevada, and I believe in you. Nobody can look past that.
Nevada, what's this sudden turn we're making?
Any luck with your cabaret routine?
Pretty good, if I do say so. But, you never know until you take the last leap and try in front of a full audience.
So, what's your plan now?
I'm not actually sure. I know that I want to do a cabaret tour after the war is over, but I'm not sure what to do right now.

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you practice in front of some of your other friends, too? I'm sure they would have their own thoughts on it.
Maybe you could try to combine your act with someone else's?
Well, nothing you can do but take that leap, then. Best to start preparing for a tour de force, as they say.

Fields.DialogueText: Not a bad idea. I'm sure that some of my sisters would have their own thoughts on how to improve. Even if Oklahoma gets all "Why can't you do it better?"
That might be fun. My song and dance is nice, but not enough for a full performance. But with others, that would give some much-needed variety.
Good point. Might as well throw myself into the fray and see how I fare.
Do you know what the theme might be?
You're right. On with the show! After we deal with some Morganas, that is.
They always choose the worst times to barge in, don't they?
@BATTLE
Something that shows off just how human we are, Captain. We're more than just weapons.
Nevada...
Don't worry, Captain. I'm sorry for bringing you down the other day.
Idle thoughts are a gamble unto themselves. For every few flights of fancy, there's a worry.
I suppose that's true. You know I'll always be here to help with those. I'm waiting for the show to go on, after all.
What are you up to now?
Just doing some research.
On submarines? I always thought you wanted to avoid getting wetter than you already are.
I know, but this pertains to my plans for the road trip. Remember how I mentioned the many landscapes below the surface?
Yes, and we won't be able to drain away the entire ocean so you can drive on it.
Sadly, I concede that point, but that's why I have a new alternative. Suppose I just sink to the bottom and drive along like that?

Fields.MenuText: I think you would have to refit yourself a lot, or it would just be you down there.
That still wouldn't solve your problem of how to travel on land, though.
It would be nice to see what the ocean looks like beneath the waves.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. I wouldn't want my buddy to miss out on the fun.
You're right. Back to the old drawing board...
Yeah, the seas are kind of nice, I guess.
Maybe I'll save the oceanic road trip for another time. We'll have enough excitement going about the world on land.
I'm sure we will. It would be nice to go under the sea, though. For one, we could admire the wrecks of these darn Morganas!
@BATTLE
You know, if we fit me with wheels and they sink me...
Don't even think about it.
Force of habit, Captain. Always be hedging your bets, right?
*ALARM*
Vroom, vroom!
Nice race car models. Interested in racing now?
That kind of high-speed chase really gets my heart racing, Captain! So I was thinking...
Uh-oh. Now what?
What I said about wheels the other day gave me an idea. Why not organize a race?
Actually, that might be kind of fun, if we managed it properly. What sort of race did you have in mind?
I'm still thinking about it. Any suggestions?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe something on board one of the ships? Just as long as we don't get carried away.
A regular ship race? There would be lots of competitors.
This have anything to do with your plans for "ship driving" on land?

Fields.DialogueText: Like a racetrack, with cars and all? That would be amazing!
Yeah, that could be a lot of fun. I would love to show Oklahoma that she can't beat me, that's for sure!
Hadn't gotten that far, but that sounds great. Thanks for the suggestion!
Actually, it might be nice to start a race in my home state. There's a lot of open space for a good, hot race.
Trying to go for the gold cup, eh?
Or silver, maybe. Anyway, we should focus on the present – those Morganas are not getting away this time!
@BATTLE
I regret making that suggestion.
Me and my big mouth.
Hey, I'd like to check in? No, that's not quite it. Excuse me, but do you have a little room for just one more? Nah.
What are you doing? Practicing lines for a comedy act or something?
No, I'm just thinking of what I might say when we check into a motel on the road.
A motel.
It's only natural to stop at an inn while traveling the country. I'm just not sure on how best to introduce myself to the staff. What do you think I should say?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe I could check us in while you wait in the car... Or on the ship.
We'd probably be fine just pitching camp in the countryside, as long as we keep stocked up on everything.
I think a bigger issue is that hotels are built for humans, not ships.

Fields.DialogueText: That could work, but I really want to see the inside of the hotel. Maybe just one little peek?
We could do some campouts on the road. But I want to still see some motels. It's a fundamental part of the whole experience!
Ah, so first I need to institute some much-needed reforms. Good to know.
You seem to be quite fascinated with motels.
Of course! There's no two that are quite alike. Plus, you never know how good it really is until you see for yourself.
And you just love to take a chance.
Exactly. Besides, it's nice to be able to relax now and then, right?
That I can agree with you on. If only the Morganas would let us.
@BATTLE
I think that would bring down the house.
Here we go again...
What's wrong, Captain? You look a little glum.
I'm just worried about our supplies. It has been a while since we could restock at a port.
Yeah, it's kind of difficult with the Morganas interfering everywhere.
I know, but we can't just keep going without medical supplies. And vegetables, for that matter.
Not to worry, Captain. I have been managing the supplies very carefully. Some cards you play close to the chest.
That's a relief.
Still, we're getting low. What are your orders?

Fields.MenuText: Start fishing for additional resources?
Try to find a place where we can dock for supplies.
Just keep things running smoothly. You've done good so far.

Fields.DialogueText: If we really wanted to, but I don't think it'll come to that.
Lots of places to dock, but only a few where we can do it safely. I'll try my best.
Thanks. I've got some experience keeping things running long-term between the wars, so I'll be fine.
By my math, we can at least make port on this. It won't be comfortable, but we won't be eating the leather on the captain's chair.
Great! We can finally restock and rest.
Well, looks like those Morganas have something else in mind. Hang on, we've got to hurry before it's too late!
@BATTLE
Hey, Captain, this a good time to talk?
@BATTLE
All right, now that we're not being shot at...
I wanted to ask what sort of things you were most interested in for our road trip.
Well, I wanted to leave a lot of it up to you.
I know. But since we're going together, I want to do things that we can both enjoy. So! What is the biggest thing you want to do while we're driving around the countries?

Fields.MenuText: Amusement parks are fun.
Something in the outdoors.
Some good, tasty dining.

Fields.DialogueText: Great choice! I can't wait to try out a roller coaster.
Ah, the great outdoors. It's so lovely to get away into the countryside. How about a stop in Death Valley, for starters?
Don't worry. I have been researching all sorts of interesting restaurants we can stop at along the road.
Anyway, I'm sure that the trip will be great. I'm really glad that you invited me along.
Thanks! I just hope we will be able to take it one day.
Don't worry. Together, we'll stop this mad war.
I'm not sure about that...
Maybe something a little cooler?
Just make sure that not all of them are spicy, okay? Not all of us have your endurance.
There's a Morgana battle group bearing down on us. What do you think?
Point taken, Captain. Even I recognize a sucker bet.
I think that last shot just barely missed me!
Shoot! This fleet is dressed to kill. You okay, Nevada?
Don't worry about me! These little water rats can't leave a dent on me!
Good to see you haven't given up yet, but we're not out of this yet.
Cheer up. This battle's almost to the explosive finale– and those enemies are the fireworks about to go off. Got any orders for me?

Fields.MenuText: Don't get cocky. It's not over until the fat lady sings.
Break them to pieces and hold nothing back. I believe in you.
Make sure you keep everyone safe.

Fields.DialogueText: No, it's until the pretty lady sings. And that's me!
You've got it! Time to put everything on the line!
Don't worry. Those ghosts won't get past me!
I need to check on everyone else, but keep up the good work.
No problem. It'll take more than this to do me in.
I've got your back if anything goes wrong. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
Room for one more?
Of course! This sunset is too big for just one to take in. But I'm trying to make it fit on this page anyway.
I didn't know you drew.
Neither did I, Captain, but there's a first time for everything. It shows, doesn't it?
Well, it's very...
Ah, it's garbage. But nobody starts their blackjack career counting cards.
Well, keep at it. You'll be able to make that desert decor yourself in no time. You know, without filling the corridors with sand.
That was one time!
True. Lightning doesn't strike twice.
Never rule anything out completely, Captain. Chance has a sense of humor.
Besides, lightning strikes the same place all the time!
Really?
No reason it shouldn't. Those deserts can have some wicked storms, too... We'll see one, one day. You and me.
Don't you get struck.
I'm a Belle. Probably wouldn't do more than make my braids stand up. But I'll put up a lightning rod for your sake.
Never hurts to hedge one's bets.
Couldn't agree more.
